dish_description: The dish is a tortilla pizza, which is a quick and easy alternative to traditional pizza. It uses a flour tortilla as the base and is topped with ingredients like tomato, onion, basil, cheese, and a drizzle of oil before being baked.

cooking_steps.description: Start by placing a flour tortilla on a surface and add about 2 teaspoons of oil on it. Use a piece of kitchen paper to spread the oil evenly on the tortilla, ensuring to use the dull side of the paper.
Thinly slice a couple of tomatoes and place the slices on the tortilla to cover it more or less completely.
Thinly slice some mild onion and scatter it over the tomato slices on the tortilla. It's important to slice the onion thinly as the pizza won't cook for very long.
Season the toppings with salt and freshly ground pepper to taste.
Add a few pieces of fresh basil on top of the other toppings for flavor.
Sprinkle a good third of a cup of cheese over the tortilla, which can be mozzarella, Gruyere, Monterey, or cheddar. Optionally, add some Parmesan cheese on top as well.
Drizzle a little more oil over the assembled pizza.
Bake the pizza in a preheated 400-degree Fahrenheit oven for about 12 to 15 minutes. Once out of the oven, you may add a bit of julienne fresh basil on top for extra fragrance and flavor.
